q: Benko believes Mike Pence could easily rally the Tea Party, which provided the GOP with the needed muscle to take back the House of Representatives and make considerable gains in the Senate during the 2010 congressional elections. You need people and you need money, and both of them are just out there waiting for an extraordinary person to unite behind, Benko told CNSNews.com. On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. ''I believe Larry is ready'' to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts. ''It's time for him to have a shot at running this.''

But he concluded that the war in Iraq has been worth the cost and remained largely unapologetic about his handling of the conflict. Had the government of Saddam Hussein remained in power the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today, he wrote in the 800-page book, which is released next Tuesday. A leading architect of the Iraq war, Mr Donald Rumsfeld was fired by Mr Bush in 2006 with US troops bogged down in Iraq.
